problem_text:
Let P = (P0, P1, P2) be a parabolic system in a finite group G, belonging to the C3 Coxeter diagram ◦
1
◦
2
◦
3
and let the Borel subgroup have index at least 3 in P0 and P1. It is known that, if we furthermore assume that the chamber system of P is geometric and that the projective planes arising as {0, 1}-residues from P are desarguesian, then either G(∞) is a Chevalley group of type C3 or B3 or G = A7. Can we obtain the same conclusion in general, without assuming the previous two hypothesis?
A. Pasini
answer: Yes, we can (S. Yoshiara, J. Algebraic Combin., 5, no. 3 (1996), 251–284).
